Dear Ms. Carey:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on March 21, 2023 . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12509 Independent living record
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following
information and documentation, which shall be
recorded within 30 calendar days after placement in
independent living and updated at least once every
90 calendar days:
(n) Change of placement documentation as required
by R400.12405.
One of two case files reviewed, one did not have a change of placement
documentation as required per the rule.
CPA Rule 400.12509 Independent living record
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following
information and documentation, which shall be
recorded within 30 calendar days after placement in
independent living and updated at least once every
90 calendar days:
(o) Service plans as required in R 400.12419 and
R 400. 12420. If the youth has biological children
The service plan must address the living
arrangement fot the child or children, visitation/
parenting time with the youth’s biological children or a

clear explanation why this is not possible or
appropriate.
Two of three independent living files reviewed contained late service plans.
Two of the seven updated service plans were late.
One report dated 07/20/22–10/17/22 was submitted on 10/18/22, 1 day late.
One report dated 10/18/22–01/15/22 was submitted on 01/19/22, 4 days late.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM RENEWAL 2021; AND INTERIM 2022
FOM DHHS POLICY Medical Passport 801- 03
All medical information within the medical passport
must be current and updated at least quarterly to
reflect the child’s current and complete health
information.
In one of three independent living files reviewed, one did not have a Medical

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. Interim
Inspection report, the report had one repeat violation from last reporting period.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator reported that they had repeat violations from their last
review. It was stated that the barriers included timely reports and employee

evaluations. It was reported that turnover in main positions in 2021 and making
adjustments affected aspects of program functioning. It is stated that the program
is staying focus and continuing to address all aspects of improving
noncompliance's.
Financial Overview
The agency presented their agency annual budget, tax return and independent
audit reports.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported the best thing about the independent living program is that the staff
are staying stable, and they have a supportive team.
No youth were interviewed during this time.
Description of Agency Walk Through
There were no safety issues noted.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no findings or safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that Spectrum Human Services Indpendent Living program will be
issued a renewal of their regular license.
